lexUnit.name: despair.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: lose or be without hope

sentence.text: The growing discrepancy is starting to make the villagers despair that any of the city 's wealth will trickle down to them .
And as the romantic in him began to despair that his dream would never materialise , his promiscuity increased .
Pausing to watch the big man stride away , his broad shoulders bent as though beneath a great weight , Tilly despaired that she could do nothing to help him .

Those who could not console themselves with the thought of world-wide respect for their domestically heartily despised ruler were at least supposed to despair when they heard Western statesmen pour flattery over Ceauşescu .
And , " she said confidingly , patting Meredith 's cold face , ` we almost despaired when he said you were determined to find out everything there was to know about your family .

British restaurant cooking had been despaired of after fifteen years of siege conditions until the counter-attack of The Good Food Guide , founded in 1951 by Raymond Postgate , a pioneering bon vivant , and compiled by himself , his friends and any members of the public who could be bothered to write in with their recommendations ( one who did was a lion tamer ) .
Another dancer of my era , who teaches Irish dancing in an Ashington school , once told me she despaired of attracting boys to her dance classes .
Sam began to despair of her evening .
By eleven-forty she despaired of his coming .
He could sense that his parents despaired of him and were beginning to put their efforts into his stronger rival and that soon …
" When you see the barbarism intae which civilised society can descend , " he said , " you despair of human nature . "
Sometimes I despair at the innumeracy of the left .
Most people are keen for their children to be educated but despair at the kind of education they receive .
Again and again he despaired at the truth .
I despair for Patrick .
On the Bani Hashem side , a prospective candidate was Ali 's first son , Hassan , who appears to have despaired of achieving anything and was comfortably defeated by Muawiyah .
Ministers and unions last night said they despaired of ending the dispute .
Fed up constantly repairing his sole pair of shoes specially built 6 years ago , John despaired of finding someone to make him another pair .
His son John had been born eight years before , when Margaret was nearly forty and they had almost despaired of having children .
Months passed and the doctor despaired of ever reaching them .
I had n't seen her since that night at the Club and I was beginning to despair of ever seeing her again .
` Oh , do n't despair yet .
That is the way of fools and failures who plunge to their own destruction because a part of them has despaired and wishes to die .
If the prospect of getting into advertising seems daunting , do n't despair .
Now , if your dog 's been behaving in an unusual way , do n't despair , you can now call in the experts .
